alert.note: Alert for Orleans (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 6:23PM EST until further notice by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Vermont, including the following counties, Caledonia, Essex and Orleans. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 622 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected in the warned area, including the East Branch of the Passumpic. Between 1.25 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lyndon, St. Johnsbury, Lyndonville Village, Kirby, West Burke Village, Wheelock, Burke, Sutton, Danville, Sheffield, Waterford, Newark Hollow, Victory, Newark, Barnet, Westmore, East Haven, Glover, Peacham and Barton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
